title: The Tower of Babel and Shem’s Line
summary: Genesis 11 tells of humanity’s attempt to build a tower to the heavens, which God stops by confusing their language. The chapter also traces the lineage from Shem to Abram.

faq.question: Why did God stop the Tower of Babel?
faq.answer: God saw humanity’s pride and disobedience, so He confused their language to scatter them.

faq.question: What’s the significance of Shem’s genealogy?
faq.answer: It leads to Abram, through whom God will initiate a covenant and the nation of Israel.

faq.question: Who is Shem?
faq.answer: Shem was one of Noah’s three sons. After the flood, his family became the ancestors of many important nations, including the Israelites. The Bible traces the family line of Jesus through Shem. His name is linked to the word 'Semitic,' which refers to people groups like the Hebrews and Arabs.
